intro: Pleomele marmorata, commonly known as the marble pleomele, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its striking, variegated leaves with a marbled pattern of green and white. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom during the wet season. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a houseplant.
